subtitle: A nutty pastry case filled with a smooth rich custard.

method.text: Place in a food processor: cashew nuts, butter, sugar, flour, eggs and vanilla. Process until well mixed and a dough is formed. Press dough into a 20 cm round fluted flan tin using your fingertips. Chill for 30 min.
Bake blind for 15 min. Remove baking beans and cook for a further 5 min. Allow to cool.
For the custard: beat eggs and sugar together until frothy. Add flour and mix until smooth. Mix in cream, rum, spices and banana slices, reserving a few to arrange around the top of the tart.
Spoon custard into the pastry case. Arrange reserved banana slices around edge. Cook in oven for 20 min or until custard is set. Serve hot or cold in slices.

title: Jamaica banana rum custard tart
